annotation.remark: Copyright details are filled in by the template.

abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Databases Application Program Interface (API).

revdescription.para: Updated for v2.0.3. Updated link to Product Feedback Forum.
Updated for v2.0.1. Updated link to Product Feedback Forum.
Updated for Infrastructure Maintenance for ORD only.
Added note about monitoring for v1.0.27.
Initial Unlimited Availability (UA) release for Rackspace Cloud Databases.

chapter.title: Document Change History
chapter.para: This version of the Release Notes replaces and obsoletes all previous versions. The most recent changes are described in the table below:

chapter.title: Monitoring Maintenance, September 3, 2013
chapter.para: This is not a code release, but rather maintenance to support monitoring for Cloud Databases instances.

listitem.para: Added support for backups. For details refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/backups.html.

Added support for monitoring all Cloud Databases instances, not just those that were created after the v1.0.27 release on July 29, 2013. For details refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/Monitoring_Cloud_Databases-d1e4673.html.
For details about the Monitoring Mgmt API refer to http://docs-internal.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-mgmt-devguide/content/Monitoring.html.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
Added support for incremental backups. Refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/backups.html for details.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!

With this release, the release numbering scheme has been changed to be easier to accomodate hotfixes using the last number. For example, v2.14.1 could be used as the release number for a hotfix for v2.14.0.

DSMYSQL-143: Add query parameter include_replicas for filtering out replicas from List all database instances and List all replicas and replica source database instances API operations. For examples, see List all instances/replica sources and filter out replicas.
DSMYSQL-157: Fixed the following backup issues:
Refresh authentication token when it expires in the middle of the backup process.
Prevent restoring uncompleted backups.
Report the correct status of backup failed, succeeded, and so forth.
DSMYSQL-178: Fix get_replication_snapshot API operation to set the location.
DSMYSQL-2 , DSMYSQL-103: trove - mha for mysql and ssh changes for cdbproxy.
DSMYSQL-167: cdbproxy-agent - change mha for mysql to run as a daemon that automatically restarts (tag 1.0.16).
Remove service catalog from repose header to fix header too long error.
Add logrotate for the haproxy log files and move the configs as templates.
Enable debugging for DNS client.
DSMYSQL-156: HA MySQL - Configure nodes and add new state.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
DSMYSQL-144: Add new API operation for List replicas for source instance. Refer to the API Devguide for details.
Release bug fixes for backups to ensure successful completion of the backup process.
Add logic to prevent users from changing the password of the replica user and causing any inadvertent change.
DSMYSQL-105: Fix trove init scripts from running process multiple times.
Monitoring squeeze fix.
DSMYSQL-18: Semi sync replication.
DSMYSQL-32: Hide Replication Users.
DSMYSQL-31: Create flavors and map OpenVZ settings.
DSMYSQL-137: Catch all exceptions from the backup runner.
DSMYSQL-141: Moving segment name handling to SwiftStorage.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
DSMYSQL-40: List replicas for a source DB instance in the instances-list call. Refer to API Devguide for details.
DSMYSQL-97: The replica detach call can only have "replica_of" in the request body. Refer to API Devguide for details.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
DSDEV-26: API call to list the default configuration parameters for a datastore version and flavor. Refer to API Devguide for details.
DSDEV-23: API call to list flavors for a datastore type and version. Refer to API Devguide for details.
DSDEV-215: Configuration parameters are not the same across regions.
DSDEV-207: Ensure Master and Replicas land on different hosts.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
Reffy roll out to V1 / V2 Debian Squeeze containers.
CDB Proxy initial setup to support replacement of CLB.

Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, HKG, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.

chapter.title: Infrastructure Maintenance ORD Only, August 14, 2013
chapter.para: This is not a code release, but rather infrastructure maintenance for the ORD datacenter only.

note.para: This maintenance applies to the ORD datacenter only. Maintenance was carried out on July 24 for all other regions.

listitem.para: Update MySQL to incorporate the latest bug fixes and security patches.
Database instance optimizations.
Updated all MySQL versions to 5.1.66.

Applied configuration enhancements for all instances. The following are the changes we are making to 512MB customers instances, with the exception of the innodb_log_buffer_size change, which will apply to all instances:
key_buffer_size = 50M -> 40M
innodb_buffer_pool_size = 150M -> 125M
innodb_log_buffer_size = 25M -> 4M (512MB) 8M (all other flavor sizes)
tmp_table_size = 16M -> 12M
max_heap_table_size = 16M -> 12M
table_open_cache = 256 -> 200
table_definition_cache = 256 -> 200
max_user_connections = 100 -> 75
max_connections = 110 -> 85
Removed container disk reservations for root.
Adjusted maximum connections per instance.
Backported instance apt repo source list to include localized mirror for:
Cloud Monitoring
Percona XtraBackup
Installed Percona XtraBackup in instances that did not have the package installed.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US and UK customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
Added note about which instances are not supported for monitoring. For details refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/Monitoring_Cloud_Databases-d1e4673.html.
D-14378: Fixed XML request on Management API for Get Monitoring Status call.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
Added support for backups. For details refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/backups.html.
Added infrastructure support for RBAC.
Added new capability to monitor Cloud Databases instances. For details refer to http://docs.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-devguide/content/Monitoring_Cloud_Databases-d1e4673.html.
For details about the Monitoring Mgmt API refer to http://docs-internal.rackspace.com/cdb/api/v1.0/cdb-mgmt-devguide/content/Monitoring.html.

note.para: The monitoring capability only applies to instances that were created after the v1.0.27 release on July 29, 2013. It does not apply to instances that were created before this release. At a later date Cloud Databases will remediate instances that were created prior to the v1.0.27 release on July 29, 2013 to support monitoring and will communicate this in the Release Notes when it is supported.

listitem.para: fdbe9239bfd906409a5f7f7ba36a1c7b9bbd04f8: Moved Rackspace DNS client for Cloud Databases to internal Cloud Databases repository.
D-12355: Fixed revert resize method to ensure correct MySQL configuration is used when revert occurs.
1181261: Updated return codes for error handling consistency.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US, UK, and SYD customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!

chapter.title: v1.0.26 Infrastructure Maintenance, July 24, 2013
chapter.para: This is not a code release, but rather infrastructure maintenance for the v1.0.26 release.

note.para: This maintenance does not apply to the ORD datacenter, which will be performed at a later date.

listitem.para: Update MySQL to incorporate the latest bug fixes and security patches.
Database instance optimizations.
Updated all MySQL versions to 5.1.66.

Applied configuration enhancements for all instances. The following are the changes we are making to 512MB customers instances, with the exception of the innodb_log_buffer_size change, which will apply to all instances:
key_buffer_size = 50M -> 40M
innodb_buffer_pool_size = 150M -> 125M
innodb_log_buffer_size = 25M -> 4M (512MB) 8M (all other flavor sizes)
tmp_table_size = 16M -> 12M
max_heap_table_size = 16M -> 12M
table_open_cache = 256 -> 200
table_definition_cache = 256 -> 200
max_user_connections = 100 -> 75
max_connections = 110 -> 85
Removed container disk reservations for root.
Adjusted maximum connections per instance.
Backported instance apt repo source list to include localized mirror for:
Cloud Monitoring
Percona XtraBackup
Installed Percona XtraBackup in instances that did not have the package installed.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US and UK customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
B-40464: Refactored code to separate internal Cloud Databases logic from RedDwarf core.
Updated code with public RedDwarf community updates.
D-12677: The following changes have been made for the Grant User Access, Create User, and Revoke User Access API calls:

Grant User Access and Create User – Users created with the Grant User Access and Create User calls are no longer given the MySQL GRANT OPTION permission. This is the permission that allows a user to grant and revoke his / her own access permissions to / from other users.
Revoke User Access – The Revoke User Access call will also now remove GRANT OPTION from non-root users. Root users still have GRANT OPTION.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.

D-09679: Improved error message handling to prevent message lockup in usage event generation service.

B-27793: Updated the usage event generation service to use the Red Dwarf common RPC libraries.

chapter.title: v1.0.6, August 1, 2012
chapter.para: We’re pleased to announce the availability of Rackspace Cloud Databases to all US and UK Open Cloud customers. These release notes cover the Unlimited Availability (UA) release of Rackspace Cloud Databases.

listitem.para: Provision MySQL database instances of varying flavor (RAM) sizes without the need to maintain and/or update MySQL. Optionally create users and databases during instance creation for quick deployment.

Critical loads with high I/O demands are performance-optimized and protected with local RAID 10 and network RAID 10. Additionally, network RAID provides synchronous replication of volumes with automatic failover and load balancing across available storage clusters.
Increase storage allocation seamlessly without downtime as your dataset size increases.
Increase or decrease flavor (RAM) size as database input/output (I/O) demands increase.
Create, list, and delete databases on your MySQL database instance.
Control database access by adding and removing MySQL users. Optionally enable root user access for additional control.
Performance improvements.
Documentation updates to the CDB Developer Guide.
Removed root user from the users list.
List users no longer shows root (or any other specified users we define).
XML Pagination works for list instances.
Kernel openvz updates.
Added Environment field to usage payload xml.
Separate the modify event into modify volume/flavor types.
Added categories searching for atom hopper billing.
Users' database privileges are not modifiable. Users must be deleted and recreated to add additional database privileges.
Get started using the Cloud Databases API to create databases in the Getting Started Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Get reference information and examples in the Cloud Databases Developer Guide at: http://docs.rackspace.com/api/.
Support for Cloud Databases is available for US and UK customers 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
Please visit our Product Feedback Forum and let us know what you think about Cloud Databases!
